Clark St, Urbana IL 61801, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Department of Astronomy, 1002 W. Green Street, Urbana IL 61801, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"John P. Hughes\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Rutgers University, Department of Physics &amp; Astronomy, 136 Frelinghuysen Rd, Piscataway NJ 08854, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Mauricio Carrasco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Zentrum f\u00fcr Astronomie, Institut f\u00fcr Theoretische Astrophysik, Philosophenweg 12, 69120 Heidelberg, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"L. Felipe Barrientos\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing analysis of PLCK G004.5\u201319.5, a Planck-discovered cluster hosting a radio relic at z = 0.52\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2014/02/05\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2014/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"562\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A43\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201321638\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2014A%26A...562A..43S\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2014/02/aa21638-13.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: PLCK G004.5-19.5\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmology: observations\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context. &lt;i/&gt;The recent discovery of a large number of galaxy clusters using the Sunyaev-Zel\u2019dovich (SZ) effect has opened a new era on the study of the most massive clusters in the Universe. Multiwavelength analyses are required to understand the properties of these new sets of clusters, which are a sensitive probe of cosmology.&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We aim for a multiwavelength characterization of PLCK G004.5\u221219.5, one of the most massive X-ray validated SZ effect-selected galaxy clusters discovered by the &lt;i&gt;Planck&lt;i/&gt; satellite.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;We have observed PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 with GMOS on the 8.1\u2009m-Gemini South Telescope for optical imaging and spectroscopy, and performed a strong lensing analysis. We also searched for associated radio emission in published catalogs.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;An analysis of the optical images confirms that this is a massive cluster, with a dominant central galaxy and an accompanying red sequence of galaxies, plus a 14\u2033-long strong lensing arc. Longslit spectroscopy of six cluster members shows that the cluster is at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.516\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.002. We also targeted the strongly lensed arc, and found &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;arc&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.601. We use LensTool to carry out a strong lensing analysis, from which we measure a median Einstein radius &lt;i&gt;\u03b8&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;s&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.6)\u00a0\u2243\u00a030\u2033 and estimate an enclosed mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a02.45&lt;sub&gt;-0.47&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+0.45&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. By extrapolating a Navarro-Frenk-White profile, we find a total mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a04.0&lt;sub&gt;-1.0&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.1&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. We also include a constraint on the mass from previous X-ray observations, which yields a slightly higher mass, &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL+X&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a06.7&lt;sub&gt;-1.3&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.6&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0&lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;, consistent with the value from strong lensing alone. Intermediate-resolution radio images from the TIFR GMRT Sky Survey at 150 MHz reveal that PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 hosts a powerful radio relic on scales \u2272500 kpc. Emission at the same location is also detected in low-resolution images at 843 MHz and 1.4 GHz. This is one of the higher redshift radio relics known to date.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=K. N. Abazajian;citation_author=J. K. function (request, callback) {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div          <div><a name=\"TFN12\" id=\"TFN12\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Nominal uncertainties on the last two digits in parentheses.</p></div>\n            <div><a name=\"TFN13\" id=\"TFN13\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Integrated flux.</p></div>\n            <div><a name=\"TFN14\" id=\"TFN14\"></a><sup>(c)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Major and minor axes.</p></div>\n            <div><a name=\"TFN15\" id=\"TFN15\"></a><sup>(d)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Position angle west of north.</p></div>\n            <div><a name=\"TFN16\" id=\"TFN16\"></a><sup>(e)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Position uncertainties from TGSS are ~4&#8243;.</p></div>\n          </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201321638\" data-edps_ref=\"aa21638-13\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" src=\"/templates/source/js/metrics-tab.js\"></script>\n\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\n                                                    </div>\n                        <nav class=\"article\">\n                           \r\n  \r\n \r\n  <div class=\"module_title\">\n    <a href=\"/\">Homepage</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"nav-section\"><div class=\"title_toc\">\n<ul class=\"menu browse\">\n<li class=\"item-452\"><a class=\" link-volumes\" href=\"/component/issues/?task=all\" >All volumes</a></li><li class=\"item-453\"><a href=\"/component/list/?task=topic\" >Special issues</a></li><li releases</a></li></ul>\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/contents/contents.html\">Table of Contents</a></div><div class=\"module_nav\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa22806-13/aa22806-13.html\" class=\"back\"><span></span>Previous article</a><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa22878-13/aa22878-13.html\" class=\"forth\">Next article<span></span></a><div class=\"clear\"></div></div></div> \n<div class=\"nav-section files\"> <h2>Article</h2><div class=\"article_doc\"><ul><li><a Hughes\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Rutgers University, Department of Physics &amp; Astronomy, 136 Frelinghuysen Rd, Piscataway NJ 08854, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Mauricio Carrasco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Zentrum f\u00fcr Astronomie, Institut f\u00fcr Theoretische Astrophysik, Philosophenweg 12, 69120 Heidelberg, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"L. Felipe Barrientos\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing analysis of PLCK G004.5\u201319.5, a Planck-discovered cluster hosting a radio relic at z = 0.52\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2014/02/05\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2014/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"562\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A43\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201321638\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2014A%26A...562A..43S\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2014/02/aa21638-13.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: PLCK G004.5-19.5\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmology: observations\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context. &lt;i/&gt;The recent discovery of a large number of galaxy clusters using the Sunyaev-Zel\u2019dovich (SZ) effect has opened a new era on the study of the most massive clusters in the Universe. Multiwavelength analyses are required to understand the properties of these new sets of clusters, which are a sensitive probe of cosmology.&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We aim for a multiwavelength characterization of PLCK G004.5\u221219.5, one of the most massive X-ray validated SZ effect-selected galaxy clusters discovered by the &lt;i&gt;Planck&lt;i/&gt; satellite.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;We have observed PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 with GMOS on the 8.1\u2009m-Gemini South Telescope for optical imaging and spectroscopy, and performed a strong lensing analysis. We also searched for associated radio emission in published catalogs.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;An analysis of the optical images confirms that this is a massive cluster, with a dominant central galaxy and an accompanying red sequence of galaxies, plus a 14\u2033-long strong lensing arc. Longslit spectroscopy of six cluster members shows that the cluster is at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.516\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.002. We also targeted the strongly lensed arc, and found &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;arc&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.601. We use LensTool to carry out a strong lensing analysis, from which we measure a median Einstein radius &lt;i&gt;\u03b8&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;s&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.6)\u00a0\u2243\u00a030\u2033 and estimate an enclosed mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a02.45&lt;sub&gt;-0.47&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+0.45&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. By extrapolating a Navarro-Frenk-White profile, we find a total mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a04.0&lt;sub&gt;-1.0&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.1&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. We also include a constraint on the mass from previous X-ray observations, which yields a slightly higher mass, &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL+X&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a06.7&lt;sub&gt;-1.3&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.6&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0&lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;, consistent with the value from strong lensing alone. Intermediate-resolution radio images from the TIFR GMRT Sky Survey at 150 MHz reveal that PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 hosts a powerful radio relic on scales \u2272500 kpc. Emission at the same location is also detected in low-resolution images at 843 MHz and 1.4 GHz. This is one of the higher redshift radio relics known to date.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=K. N. Abazajian;citation_author=J. K. Adelman-McCarthy;citation_author=M. A. Ag\u00fceros;citation_publication_date=2009;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=182;citation_firstpage=543;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=N. Ben\u00edtez;citation_publication_date=2000;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=536;citation_firstpage=571;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=B. A. function (request, callback) {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico Hughes\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Rutgers University, Department of Physics &amp; Astronomy, 136 Frelinghuysen Rd, Piscataway NJ 08854, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Mauricio Carrasco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Zentrum f\u00fcr Astronomie, Institut f\u00fcr Theoretische Astrophysik, Philosophenweg 12, 69120 Heidelberg, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"L. Felipe Barrientos\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing analysis of PLCK G004.5\u201319.5, a Planck-discovered cluster hosting a radio relic at z = 0.52\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2014/02/05\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2014/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"562\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A43\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201321638\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2014A%26A...562A..43S\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2014/02/aa21638-13.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: PLCK G004.5-19.5\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmology: observations\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context. &lt;i/&gt;The recent discovery of a large number of galaxy clusters using the Sunyaev-Zel\u2019dovich (SZ) effect has opened a new era on the study of the most massive clusters in the Universe. Multiwavelength analyses are required to understand the properties of these new sets of clusters, which are a sensitive probe of cosmology.&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We aim for a multiwavelength characterization of PLCK G004.5\u221219.5, one of the most massive X-ray validated SZ effect-selected galaxy clusters discovered by the &lt;i&gt;Planck&lt;i/&gt; satellite.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;We have observed PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 with GMOS on the 8.1\u2009m-Gemini South Telescope for optical imaging and spectroscopy, and performed a strong lensing analysis. We also searched for associated radio emission in published catalogs.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;An analysis of the optical images confirms that this is a massive cluster, with a dominant central galaxy and an accompanying red sequence of galaxies, plus a 14\u2033-long strong lensing arc. Longslit spectroscopy of six cluster members shows that the cluster is at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.516\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.002. We also targeted the strongly lensed arc, and found &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;arc&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.601. We use LensTool to carry out a strong lensing analysis, from which we measure a median Einstein radius &lt;i&gt;\u03b8&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;s&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.6)\u00a0\u2243\u00a030\u2033 and estimate an enclosed mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a02.45&lt;sub&gt;-0.47&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+0.45&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. By extrapolating a Navarro-Frenk-White profile, we find a total mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a04.0&lt;sub&gt;-1.0&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.1&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. We also include a constraint on the mass from previous X-ray observations, which yields a slightly higher mass, &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL+X&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a06.7&lt;sub&gt;-1.3&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.6&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0&lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;, consistent with the value from strong lensing alone. Intermediate-resolution radio images from the TIFR GMRT Sky Survey at 150 MHz reveal that PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 hosts a powerful radio relic on scales \u2272500 kpc. Emission at the same location is also detected in low-resolution images at 843 MHz and 1.4 GHz. This is one of the higher redshift radio relics known to date.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=K. N. Abazajian;citation_author=J. K. Adelman-McCarthy;citation_author=M. A. Ag\u00fceros;citation_publication_date=2009;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=182;citation_firstpage=543;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=N. Ben\u00edtez;citation_publication_date=2000;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=536;citation_firstpage=571;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=B. A. Benson;citation_author=T. de Haan;citation_author=J. P. function (request, callback) {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico <meta name=\"citation_journal_title\" content=\"Astronomy &amp; Astrophysics\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_journal_abbrev\" content=\"A&amp;A\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publisher\" content=\"EDP Sciences\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Crist\u00f3bal Sif\u00f3n\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, PO Box 9513, 2300 RA Clark St, Urbana IL 61801, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Department of Astronomy, 1002 W. Green Street, Urbana IL 61801, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"John P. Hughes\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Rutgers University, Department of Physics &amp; Astronomy, 136 Frelinghuysen Rd, Piscataway NJ 08854, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Mauricio Carrasco\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Zentrum f\u00fcr Astronomie, Institut f\u00fcr Theoretische Astrophysik, Philosophenweg 12, 69120 Heidelberg, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"L. Felipe Barrientos\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Departamento de Astronom\u00eda y Astrof\u00edsica, Facultad de F\u00edsica, Pontificia Universidad Cat\u00f3lica de Chile, Casilla 306, 22 Santiago, Chile\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"Strong lensing analysis of PLCK G004.5\u201319.5, a Planck-discovered cluster hosting a radio relic at z = 0.52\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2014/02/05\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2014/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"562\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A43\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201321638\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2014A%26A...562A..43S\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2014/02/aa21638-13/aa21638-13.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2014/02/aa21638-13.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: PLCK G004.5-19.5\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmology: observations\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context. &lt;i/&gt;The recent discovery of a large number of galaxy clusters using the Sunyaev-Zel\u2019dovich (SZ) effect has opened a new era on the study of the most massive clusters in the Universe. Multiwavelength analyses are required to understand the properties of these new sets of clusters, which are a sensitive probe of cosmology.&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We aim for a multiwavelength characterization of PLCK G004.5\u221219.5, one of the most massive X-ray validated SZ effect-selected galaxy clusters discovered by the &lt;i&gt;Planck&lt;i/&gt; satellite.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;We have observed PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 with GMOS on the 8.1\u2009m-Gemini South Telescope for optical imaging and spectroscopy, and performed a strong lensing analysis. We also searched for associated radio emission in published catalogs.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;An analysis of the optical images confirms that this is a massive cluster, with a dominant central galaxy and an accompanying red sequence of galaxies, plus a 14\u2033-long strong lensing arc. Longslit spectroscopy of six cluster members shows that the cluster is at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a00.516\u00a0\u00b1\u00a00.002. We also targeted the strongly lensed arc, and found &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;arc&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.601. We use LensTool to carry out a strong lensing analysis, from which we measure a median Einstein radius &lt;i&gt;\u03b8&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;s&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a01.6)\u00a0\u2243\u00a030\u2033 and estimate an enclosed mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;E&lt;sub/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a02.45&lt;sub&gt;-0.47&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+0.45&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. By extrapolating a Navarro-Frenk-White profile, we find a total mass &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a04.0&lt;sub&gt;-1.0&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.1&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt; &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;. We also include a constraint on the mass from previous X-ray observations, which yields a slightly higher mass, &lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;500&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;SL+X&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0=\u00a06.7&lt;sub&gt;-1.3&lt;sub/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;+2.6&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0\u00d7\u00a010&lt;sup&gt;14&lt;sup/&gt;\u00a0&lt;i&gt;M&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;\u2299&lt;sub/&gt;, consistent with the value from strong lensing alone. Intermediate-resolution radio images from the TIFR GMRT Sky Survey at 150 MHz reveal that PLCK G004.5\u221219.5 hosts a powerful radio relic on scales \u2272500 kpc. Emission at the same location is also detected in low-resolution images at 843 MHz and 1.4 GHz. This is one of the higher redshift radio relics known to date.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=K. N. Abazajian;citation_author=J. K. Adelman-McCarthy;citation_author=M. A. Ag\u00fceros;citation_publication_date=2009;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=182;citation_firstpage=543;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=N. Ben\u00edtez;citation_publication_date=2000;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=536;citation_firstpage=571;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=B. A.         data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n class=\"wrap\" >\n                              \n<div class=\"breadcrumbs\">\n\n\n\n<a href=\"/\" class=\"pathway\">Home</a> <img src=\"/media/system/images/arrow.png\" alt=\"\"  /> <a
